intro: Commiphora lobatospathulata, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It produces a resinous sap that has been used traditionally for its aromatic and medicinal properties. The species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
